sen.j: 大内 定綱（おおうち さだつな、天文 (元号)14年（1545年） － 慶長15年（1610年））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Sadatsuna OUCHI (1545 - 1610) is a warlord of the Sengoku period (Japan).
Sadatsuna OUCHI (1545 - 1610) is a warlord of the Sengoku period (Japan).
Sadatsuna OUCHI (1545 - 1610) was a warlord of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 仮名 (通称)は太郎左衛門、勘解由左衛門。
sen.e: His pseudonyms (common names) are Tarozaemon and Kageyuzaemon.
His pseudonyms (common names) are Tarozaemon and Kageyuzaemon.
His pseudonyms (common names) are Tarozaemon and Kageyuzaemon.

sen.j: 受領名は備前守。
sen.e: His juryomei (allowance to be called with a special rank name adding his country name) is Bizen no kami (the governor of Bizen Province).
His juryomei (permission to be addressed by special title adding the name of his province) is Bizen no kami (the governor of Bizen Province).
His special title was Governor of Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 法号は廉也斎。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) is Renyasai.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) is Renyasai.
His Buddhist name was Renyasai.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 父は大内義綱。
sen.e: His father is Yoshitsuna OUCHI.
His father is Yoshitsuna OUCHI.
His father was Yoshitsuna OUCHI.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 弟に片平親綱。
sen.e: Chikatsuna KATAHIRA is his younger brother.
Chikatsuna KATAHIRA is his younger brother.
Chikatsuna KATAHIRA was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 子に大内重綱がいる。
sen.e: One of his children is Shigetsuna OUCHI.
One of his children is Shigetsuna OUCHI.
Among his children was Shigetsuna OUCHI.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 陸奥国安達郡小浜城_(陸奥国)主。
sen.e: He was the castellan of the Obama Castle, Adachi District, Mutsu Province (Mutsu-no-kuni).
He was the castellan of the Obama Castle, Adachi District, Mutsu Province (Mutsu-no-kuni).
He was the castellan of the Obama-jo Castle, Adachi District, Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 後に伊達氏家臣。
sen.e: Later he became a vassal of the Date clan.
Later he became a vassal of the Date clan.
Later he became a vassal of the Date clan.

sen.j: 本姓は多々良氏。
sen.e: His original surname is the Tatara clan.
His original surname is the Tatara clan.
His original surname was Tatara.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 大内氏は、父・義綱の代に田村氏の内応工作に応じて主君・石橋尚義を追放し、塩松領主となって田村氏の旗下に属していたが、家督を継いだ定綱は、田村・大内両家の家臣同士の争いの裁決に対する不満から、次第に田村氏からの独立を目論むようになる。
sen.e: During the reign of the father, Yoshitsuna, the Ouchi clan complied with demand of the Tamura clan and banished their lord, Hisayoshi ISHIBASHI, became the feudal lord of Shionomatsu (eastern part of Adachi District) and belonged under the command of the Tamura clan; however, Sadatsuna, who took over as head of the family, gradually planned to gain independence due to his frustration against decisions over conflicts between vassals of the Tamura and Ouchi clans.

During the reign of his father, Yoshitsuna, the Ouchi clan complied with demand of the Tamura clan and banished their lord, Hisayoshi ISHIBASHI, became the feudal lord of Shionomatsu (eastern part of Adachi District) and belonged under the command of the Tamura clan; however, Sadatsuna, who took over as head of the family, gradually planned to gain independence due to his frustration about decisions made over conflicts between vassals of the Tamura and Ouchi clans.

During the reign of his father, Yoshitsuna, Ouchi clan complied with the demand of the Tamura clan and banished their lord, Hisayoshi ISHIBASHI; and Yoshitsuna became the feudal lord of Shionomatsu (eastern part of Adachi District) and belonged under the command of the Tamura clan; however, Sadatsuna, who took over as head of the family, gradually planned to gain independence due to his frustration about decisions made over conflicts between vassals of the Tamura and Ouchi clans.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 1582年、伊達輝宗が小斎城を攻めた際に、輝宗の陣に参上して傘下に入る。
sen.e: When Terumune DATE attacked Kosai-jo Castle in 1582, Sadatsuna OUCHI called on Terumune in his territory to be under his leadership.
When Terumune DATE attacked Kosai-jo Castle in 1582, Sadatsuna OUCHI called on Terumune in his territory to come under his leadership.
When Terumune DATE attacked Kosai-jo Castle in 1582, Sadatsuna OUCHI called on Terumune to come under his leadership in his territory.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: またこの頃、娘を二本松城主畠山義継の子・二本松義綱に嫁がせて足場を固めた。
sen.e: Also around the same time, Sadatsuna married off his daughter to Yoshitsuna NIHONMATSU, a son of Yoshitsugu HATAKEYAMA, the castellan of the Nihonmatsu Castle, to consolidate a foothold.
Also around the same time, Sadatsuna married off his daughter to Yoshitsuna NIHONMATSU, the son of Yoshitsugu HATAKEYAMA, the castellan of the Nihonmatsu Castle, to consolidate a foothold.
Also around the same time, Sadatsuna had his daughter marry Yoshitsuna NIHONMATSU, the son of Yoshitsugu HATAKEYAMA, the castellan of the Nihonmatsu-jo Castle, to consolidate a foothold.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。城名表記を変えました。

sen.j: こうして1583年、田村領の百目木城主石川光昌（石橋氏旧臣、義綱と組んで尚義を追放した）を攻撃、田村氏と対立していた蘆名盛隆の支援を受けて田村清顕を破り独立を果たす。
sen.e: In so doing, in 1583 he attacked Mitsumasa ISHIKAWA, the castellan of the Domeki-jo Castle in Tamura territory (he banished Hisayoshi in conspiracy with the old retainer of the Ishibashi clan and Yoshitsuna), defeated Kiyoaki TAMURA with the support of Moritaka ASHINA, who was an enemy of the Tamura clan, and succeeded in gaining independence.

In so doing, in 1583 he attacked Mitsumasa ISHIKAWA, the castellan of the Domeki-jo Castle in Tamura territory (he banished Hisayoshi in conspiracy with the old retainer of the Ishibashi clan and Yoshitsuna), defeated Kiyoaki TAMURA with the support of Moritaka ASHINA, who was an enemy of the Tamura clan, and succeeded in gaining independence.

In 1583 he attacked Mitsumasa ISHIKAWA, the castellan of the Domeki-jo Castle in Tamura territory (he banished Hisayoshi in conspiracy with the old retainer of the Ishibashi clan and Yoshitsuna), defeated Kiyoaki TAMURA with the support of Moritaka ASHINA, who was an enemy of the Tamura clan, and succeeded in gaining independence.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。城名表記を変えました。

sen.j: しかし、1584年に輝宗の子・伊達政宗（正室は田村清顕の娘・愛姫）が家督を継ぐと、政宗は田村氏に加担して定綱を攻撃し、小手森城で撫で斬りを行うなどしたため、定綱は小浜城を放棄して二本松へ逃れ、ついで会津の蘆名氏を頼った。
sen.e: However, after Masamune DATE, a son of Terumune (his lawful wife is Aihime (Princess Ai), a daughter of Kiyoaki TAMURA) took over as head of the family in 1584, Masamune sided with the Tamura clan and attacked Sadatsuna, one of such attacks being a clean sweep of opponents in Odemori-jo Castle; thus Sadatsuna abandoned Odemori-jo Castle and escaped to Nihonmatsu (a town in Adachi District), and then relied on the Ashina clan.

However, after Masamune DATE, the son of Terumune (his lawful wife is Aihime (Princess Ai), the daughter of Kiyoaki TAMURA) took over as head of the family in 1584, Masamune sided with the Tamura clan and attacked Sadatsuna, one of such attacks being a clean sweep of opponents in Odemori-jo Castle; thus Sadatsuna abandoned Odemori-jo Castle and escaped to Nihonmatsu (a town in Adachi District), and then relied upon the Ashina clan.

However, after Masamune DATE, the son of Terumune (his lawful wife was Princess Ai, the daughter of Kiyoaki TAMURA) took over as head of the family in 1584, Masamune sided with the Tamura clan and attacked Sadatsuna, one of such attacks being a clean sweep of opponents in Odemori-jo Castle; thus Sadatsuna abandoned Obama-jo Castle and escaped to Nihonmatsu (a town in Adachi District), and then relied upon the Ashina clan of Aizu Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。城名表記を変えました。

sen.j: 1588年、郡山合戦の際には蘆名氏の部将として苗代田城を攻略するが、伊達成実の誘いに応じて弟の片平親綱と共に伊達氏に帰参した。
sen.e: During the Koriyama War in 1588, he captured the Nawashiroda-jo Castle as a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Ashina clan, but retuned to the DATE clan with his younger brother, Chikatsuna KATAHIRA, at the invitation of Shigezane DATE.

During the Koriyama War in 1588, he captured the Nawashiroda-jo Castle as a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Ashina clan, but retuned to the DATE clan with his younger brother, Chikatsuna KATAHIRA, at the invitation of Shigezane DATE.

During the Battle of Koriyama in 1588, he captured the Nawashiroda-jo Castle as a Japanese military commander of the Ashina clan, but retuned to the Date clan with his younger brother, Chikatsuna KATAHIRA, at the invitation of Shigezane DATE.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 以後は、摺上原の戦いや葛西大崎一揆、文禄・慶長の役にも従軍して功績を立てた。
sen.e: After that, he rendered distinguished service by serving in the Suriagehara War, Kasai-Osaki Ikki Uprisings, and the Bunroku-Keicho War.
After that, he rendered distinguished service by serving in the Suriagehara War, Kasai-Osaki Ikki Uprisings, and the Bunroku-Keicho War.
He subsequently served with distinction in the Battle of Suriagehara, Kasai-Osaki Ikki Uprisings, and the Bunroku-Keicho War.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 1591年、政宗が岩出山城に転封されると、胆沢郡に20邑余（およそ10000石）の所領を与えられ、前沢城主となった。
sen.e: When Masamune's territory changed to Iwadeyama-jo Castle in 1588, Sadatsuna was granted a territory of over 20 settlements (approx. 10,000 koku) in Isawa-gun, and became the castellan of the Maesawa-jo Castle.

When Masamune's territory changed to Iwadeyama-jo Castle in 1588, Sadatsuna was granted a territory of over 20 settlements (approx. 10,000 koku) in Isawa-gun, and became the castellan of the Maesawa-jo Castle.

When Masamune's territory changed to Iwadeyama-jo Castle in 1591, Sadatsuna was granted a territory of over 20 settlements (approx. 10,000 koku) in Isawa-gun, and became the castellan of the Maesawa-jo Castle.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いの折には京都伊達屋敷の留守居役を務めた。
sen.e: In the Battle of Sekigahara, he served as a rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence) of the residence of Date in Kyoto.
In the Battle of Sekigahara, he served as a rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence) of the residence of Date in Kyoto.
In the Battle of Sekigahara, he minded Date's residence in Kyoto in Date's absence.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 子の重綱の代にはこれらの功績により、一族の家格を与えられた。
sen.e: As a result of these achievements, the clan was granted the house status during the reign of the son, Shigetsuna.
As a result of these achievements, the clan was granted house status during the reign of the son, Shigetsuna.
As a result of these achievements, the clan was granted a title during the reign of the son, Shigetsuna.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 定綱自身は戦上手として名高く、調略にも長け、また槍術（十文字槍）にも優れていたという。
sen.e: Sadatsuna was famous for being skilled at battle and stratagem, and is also said to have been excellent at the art of the spearmanship (Juji-yari (crisscross spear)).
Sadatsuna was famous for being skilled at battle and stratagem, and is also said to have been excellent in the art of the spearmanship (Juji-yari (crisscross spear)).
Sadatsuna was famous for being skilled at battle and stratagem, and is also said to have been an excellent spearman with a cross headed spear.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
